example.description: This example gets all available patches for Windows Server 2012 that have a MSRC severity of Critical. The syntax used by this example requires PowerShell version 3 or later.

example.code:
PS C:\> $filter1 = New-Object Amazon.SimpleSystemsManagement.Model.PatchOrchestratorFilter PS C:\> $filter1.Key = "PRODUCT" PS C:\> $filter1.Values = "WindowsServer2012" PS C:\> $filter2 = New-Object Amazon.SimpleSystemsManagement.Model.PatchOrchestratorFilter PS C:\> $filter2.Key = "MSRC_SEVERITY" PS C:\> $filter2.Values = "Critical"
PS C:\> Get-SSMAvailablePatch -Filter $filter1,$filter2
example.description: With PowerShell version 2, you must use New-Object to create each filter.

example.code:
Get-SSMAvailablePatch | Where-Object ReleaseDate -ge (Get-Date).AddDays(-20) | Where-Object Product -eq "WindowsServer2019" | Select-Object ReleaseDate, Product, Title
